Why is it important to upgrade to v1.0.1 or later for continued mainnet and testnet use?

Upgrading to v1.0.1 or later is mandatory for continued mainnet and testnet use because it addresses critical issues discovered in the previous version, including one found on the public testnet and another found during additional coverage testing. This upgrade ensures the ability of the network to respond to unexpected events quickly, safely, and without compromising decentralization.

In addition to fixing an issue discovered by cautionfun#3236 on the current public testnet, this version also addresses an issue discovered during additional coverage testing in the oracle based, reversible rip-cord implementations to ensure the ability for the network to respond to any unexpected events quickly, safely, and without compromise to decentralization.
